topics: A safety confirmation app becomes popular in China
The background of cases involving the misuse of AI images
Starlink to offer free connections in Iran

intro.speaker: Steve
intro.text: Hello everyone, and welcome to 'Japan News Explained'. I'm Steve.

intro.speaker: Nancy
intro.text: And I'm Nancy. Today, we have three interesting IT topics from Japan.

news.original_title: 安否確認アプリ 中国で爆発的人気

introduction.speaker: Steve
introduction.text: First up, a Japanese-style safety confirmation app is a huge hit in China.

introduction.speaker: Nancy
introduction.text: Wow, a safety app? Why is it so popular there?

vocabulary_hook.speaker: Nancy
vocabulary_hook.text: The article mentions a 'surge' in popularity. What does 'surge' mean?

vocabulary_hook.speaker: Steve
vocabulary_hook.text: 'Surge' means a sudden and great increase in something.

deep_dive.speaker: Steve
deep_dive.text: The app is called 'Are You Dead?'. It asks users to check in daily.

deep_dive.speaker: Nancy
deep_dive.text: That's a very direct name! So what happens if you don't check in?

deep_dive.speaker: Steve
deep_dive.text: If a user doesn't respond for two days, it sends an alert to their emergency contact.

deep_dive.speaker: Nancy
deep_dive.text: I see. This is for people living alone. Is that common in China?

deep_dive.speaker: Steve
deep_dive.text: Yes, the number of single-person households is growing rapidly in China's big cities.

discussion.speaker: Nancy
discussion.text: It's interesting how a simple app can provide peace of mind for families.

discussion.speaker: Steve
discussion.text: Exactly. It shows how technology can address social changes like increasing isolation.

news.original_title: スターリンク イランで接続無料化

introduction.speaker: Steve
introduction.text: Our final story is about Starlink. It's making its internet connection free in Iran.

introduction.speaker: Nancy
introduction.text: Starlink is Elon Musk's satellite internet, right? Why is it free in Iran?

vocabulary_hook.speaker: Nancy
vocabulary_hook.text: The reports mention 'censorship'. What does 'censorship' mean?

vocabulary_hook.speaker: Steve
vocabulary_hook.text: Censorship is when an authority, like a government, controls information and communication.

deep_dive.speaker: Steve
deep_dive.text: The Iranian government has been shutting down the internet to control protests.

deep_dive.speaker: Nancy
deep_dive.text: So people can't communicate or get news?

deep_dive.speaker: Steve
deep_dive.text: Exactly. Starlink's service helps people bypass these government restrictions.

deep_dive.speaker: Nancy
deep_dive.text: Is it legal to use Starlink there?

deep_dive.speaker: Steve
deep_dive.text: No, it's banned. People have to smuggle the receivers into the country to use the service.

discussion.speaker: Nancy
discussion.text: So technology can be a powerful tool for freedom of speech.

discussion.speaker: Steve
discussion.text: It can be. This shows how global technology can directly impact people's lives during political crises.

outro.speaker: Steve
outro.text: That's all the time we have for today. Thanks for joining us.

outro.speaker: Nancy
outro.text: Yes, thank you for listening! We hope you'll tune in next time.
